job_title: Licensed Clinical Addiction Counselor in Indianapolis, IN
pros: Great benefits for Social Services
cons: Hard Work but satisfying. High productivity expectations.

pros: Office is a great group of people to work with. Very supportive of each other
cons: Pay rate too low. Company has too many levels of management

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Jeff, IN
pros: Give you a lot of PTO to use
cons: Horrible pay and a lot of drama

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Jasper, IN
pros: Lots of PTO. Health insurance available
cons: Will not give you a straight answer if you ask about something new to you. You will be told " you do not kneed to know that"

pros: Great coworkers, supportive supervisors in most settings and departments. Local offices, regions work well, supportive, opportunities for trainings and professional development.
cons: Organization of company, upper management and positions, not conducive to moving company forward.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Jasper, IN
pros: Helped clients in the residential setting
cons: They gave a huge starting pay increase for mental health techs but didn't change the wages across the board with it. Pay needs to be better. It isn't a livable wage. Still had to be on assistance.

job_title: Accounts Receivable Specialist in Clarksville, IN
pros:
My co workers are great
Very lenient with time off requests, both paid and unpaid if needed
cons:
There is little to no proper training, you'll be expected to figure things out for yourself a lot of the time.
The pay is god awful. I make 13 an hour for a very complicated job that should easily pay 16, minimum.

pros: PTO and flexibility with home life
cons: Better Pay for positions through your agency

job_title: Out Patient Care Coordinator in Jasper, IN
pros: Direct supervisors and coworkers were extremely supportive and team atmosphere.
cons: Upper management would not always listen to the lower level positions in regards to concerns and barriers.

review_title: Work here if you don't mind being underpaid
pros: Lovely co-workers, flexible hours, and very rewarding.
cons: Low pay, high insurance premiums, non- profit who worries too much about billing & not enough about the clients, mandating a vaccine that hasn't proved any resistance to the virus 🙄

pros: Love the clients I work with and my coworkers
cons: Management, poor pay compared to most places

review_title: Should pay more, but you have freedom
job_title: Care Manager in New Albany, IN
pros: Flexible schedule, 4% raise per year if you meet production, 401k profit sharing.
cons: Hyper focused on production! It is CRAMMED down your throat and constantly brought up even though there is nothing you can possibly do to ensure that clients make their appointments. Pay should be AT LEAST DOUBLE what it is. This position requires a Bachelor degree and you make as much as someone working drive through at Chik-fil-A or Target. Management is disjointed and disconnected. Upper management does not listen and is entrenched in the idea that "they are doing it right." They do not listen to feedback.

job_title: Engagement Specialist in New Albany, IN
pros: The company makes sure employees are paid fairly and every expense is paid. Including mileage, office supplies, and on call pay.
cons: New programs are lacking work. Expected to work 40 hours but do not have 40 hours of work. Very large company that does not always communicate well.

pros: Good people and company to work for
cons: Not much room for growth

review_title: Leading agency, caring staff, fulfilling work
pros:
Leadership cares for staff, clients and community
Retirement contributions of 6%
Annual raises
Opportunity for student loan Reimbursement
Qualified and seasoned peers to learn from
Patient care is a priority
Flexible schedules when needed
Generous PTO
Opportunity for growth
cons:
Insurance is expensive 
Staffing shortages statewide

pros: Friendly staff, great patients. Felt at home here.
cons: Lower pay, not enough staff.

pros: Flexibility, plenty of trainings. It's a job. But can be a bit too much.
cons: Productivity hours are too high. Working in field of social work. Hours should be reduced to 20 in forty hour week. 24 hours takes about 48 to 50 hours to get. Be better! Don't be like others

pros: Connect directly with your clients on a regular
cons: Overworked, not much compassion once pandemic hit

job_title: Care Manager in Tell City, IN
pros: You get every weekend off and the occasionally holiday
cons: The company completely prioritizes productivity over both worker and client mental health. Ironic for a nonprofit community mental health center.

job_title: President/Chief Executive Officer in Jeffersonville, IN
pros: At LifeSpring the two positive attributes of the organization  that staff members list most often  are their relationships with their coworkers and  the contact they have with the clients we serve. After working at five community mental health centers over the year I have found Life Spring to have the most welcoming, competent,  and compassionate staff of any placed I have worked. Please consider joining this caring team of professionals if you want to make a positive contribution to your community. Benefits are more than competitive and LifeSpring strives to be  flexible to allow for work and home balance.
cons: Our starting  salaries are not always the highest, although LifeSpring has  consistently given raises over the years. The work can be very challenging and demanding and requires a high level of  professional interpersonal skills

review_title: Great place to work!  I love it here!
pros: LifeSpring is true to their mission of helping those with mental illness and substance abuse problems.  Staff are caring to the patients and to each other.  Benefits are good for the size of company it is, especially the retirement/pension plan and tuition assistance.  I have been amazed that when staff do leave, they want to come back right away.   We've been growing a lot lately with the addition of primary care services for our patients and the communities we serve.   A lot of flexibility for staff, especially in non-clinical positions.  I can't imagine working anywhere else!
cons: Pay could be a little better but it is a not-for-profit.  We have gotten 4% annual increases for several years now and I don't see other companies doing that for their staff now days.  So it could be worse!

pros: The clients. The schedule - nights, weekends, and holidays off. Mileage reimbursement. Variety to work day.
cons: Constant turnover of management. Poor morale. Toxic work environment. Office staff continually gossiped about therapists and support staff. New employees not properly trained. Bullies. Tattle tales. Staff with access to private employee information - some of which is very sensitive, HIPAA protected information - discussing said information (gossiping) to other staff. I even witnessed coworkers making fun of other coworkers regarding their sexual preference. Executive management completely disinterested in any wrongdoing to lower level staff. Basically if you didn't have a master's degree, you didn't matter.

pros:
Flexible schedule. You make your own schedule with patients. You can work a 4 day week if you wanted to as well. 
Very independent work. You are your own boss, but must report to superior. You get a monthly bonus for billing enough hours of working with patients. 
Tuition reimbursement for school up to $2000 for a calendar year.
cons: Very independent job, will need to be a go getter, ask questions for help, and willing to make mistakes to learn from. Baptism by fire.

review_title: Love it here! Hope to retire from LifeSpring.
pros: I've never worked with such an incredible group of visionary health professionals before. Everyone from front desk staff to the CEO is absolutely committed to serving our patients and our communities. As a working parent- I've never been made to feel like I have to choose between my kids and my job. My supervisors have always been awesome when my kids have gotten ill, etc. Would highly recommend to close friends and family.
cons: Things are always changing but that's mostly because  state and federal regulations are always changing. Constantly having to adapt to the evolving healthcare landscape.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse for Scott Co Branch Office in Jeffersonville, IN
pros:
Continuel education. 
Renewing courses
Opportunities to learn new medications thru pharmaceutical companies hosting dinners. 
Each branch office always ready to assist each other.
My boss Wanda...wonderful nurse and person. Respected her very much.
Liked the people I worked with / you become family.
Pay and benefits were really good
cons:
The amount of work flowing thru each office could be quite staggering. 
Usually too much for one nurse realistically.

review_title: Great team to work with, I look forward to continued professional growth.
job_title: Clinical Manager in Southern Ute Indian Reservat, CO
pros: Enthusiastic and professional team of staff from the ground up.  A leader in the service arena for mental health, addiction and primary care.
cons: Working within the human serve field can be challenging.  Providing care within the constraints of a larger system that constantly changes can be difficult without appropriate skills.

review_title: This company does not take care of there employees
job_title: Case Manager in New Albany, IN
pros: If you have a supervisor that values you it can make your experience with the company tolerable otherwise it's unbearable to have to deal with coworkers.
cons: Upper management does not care about there employees, employees gossip about one another constantly, the pay is ridiculous and you are constantly worried that if someone doesn't like you they will go to upper management and try and get you fired (which happens often)

review_title: It's a good company with a strong mission
pros: Flexible hours and typical 4% annual pay raise
cons: Mileage, although reimbursed at state minimum, is a lot. Stressful meeting production when your job hangs on the line of whether your client feels like meeting or not. Advancement at all requires you have a masters degree.

review_title: Awesome organization making huge impact in Southern Indiana!
job_title: Senior Vice President in Jeffersonville, IN
pros: LifeSpring is a growing company with a lot of opportunity for positively impacting the health and welfare of individuals, families, and communities.
cons: It can be difficult to navigate ever-changing payer systems and governmental regulations.

pros: It is a great job to help others
cons: The pay is low for the amount of training and education required. Lack of pay increase for the PRN employees

pros: There is little to no accountability here and you can do whatever you want
cons: management unresponsive, pay is terrible, bias, laziness and incompetency is all around. no one is held accountable for any wrongdoing
